metadata.title: C-D-E Simple Pattern
metadata.description: Play the first three notes of the C major scale using quarter notes

hints.beforeStart: Place your thumb (1) on Middle C, index (2) on D, middle (3) on E. Keep your hand relaxed and curved. Play each note clearly with a quarter-note rhythm.

commonMistakes.advice: Count aloud: '1-2-3-4' for each measure. Each note should land exactly on a beat. Match the metronome precisely.
Play each note cleanly and release it. Don't hold notes longer than the beat. Move to the next note on the metronome click.
Relax your hand between notes. You shouldn't feel tension in your wrist or forearm. Keep fingers gently curved.

hints.successMessage: Perfect! You've played your first scale pattern with the correct fingering. This is the foundation for right-hand technique.
